prompts.title: Product Launch Email Campaign
prompts.description: Create a compelling email sequence to announce your new product launch
prompts.prompt:
Write a 3-email sequence for launching [Product Name]. 

Email 1: Teaser email (7 days before launch)
- Subject: Something big is coming...
- Build anticipation without revealing the product
- Hint at the problem it solves

Email 2: Pre-launch announcement (3 days before launch)
- Subject: Get ready to transform [Target Audience]'s [Pain Point]
- Reveal the product name and key benefit
- Include early bird offer details

Email 3: Launch day
- Subject: [Product Name] is now live! ðŸŽ‰
- Clear call-to-action to purchase
- Include social proof/testimonials
- Create urgency with limited-time offer

Target audience: [Target Audience Description]
Brand voice: [Brand Voice Guidelines]
Key differentiator: [What makes this product unique]

prompts.title: Business SWOT Analysis Framework
prompts.description: Comprehensive SWOT analysis template for strategic business planning
prompts.prompt:
Conduct a comprehensive SWOT analysis for [Company Name] in the [Industry] industry.

STRENGTHS (Internal, Positive):
- What are our core competencies?
- What unique resources do we have?
- What do customers perceive as our strengths?
- What advantages do we have over competitors?
- Financial strengths: [Financial Metrics]
- Team strengths: [Team Capabilities]

WEAKNESSES (Internal, Negative):
- What areas need improvement?
- What resources are we lacking?
- What do customers complain about?
- Where are we vulnerable?
- Operational gaps: [Operational Issues]
- Skill gaps: [Skill Deficiencies]

OPPORTUNITIES (External, Positive):
- What market trends can we leverage?
- What technological changes benefit us?
- What regulatory changes help us?
- Market gaps: [Market Opportunities]
- Partnership possibilities: [Potential Partners]

THREATS (External, Negative):
- What obstacles do we face?
- Who are our emerging competitors?
- What technological changes threaten us?
- Market challenges: [Market Threats]
- Regulatory risks: [Regulatory Concerns]

Based on this analysis, recommend 3 strategic priorities for the next [Time Period].

prompts.title: LinkedIn Thought Leadership Post
prompts.description: Create engaging LinkedIn posts to establish thought leadership in your industry
prompts.prompt:
Write a LinkedIn thought leadership post about [Topic] for [Your Role/Title].

Structure:
1. HOOK (first 2 lines): Start with a surprising statistic, provocative question, or relatable pain point about [Topic]

2. CONTEXT: Briefly explain why this matters to [Target Audience] right now

3. INSIGHT: Share your unique perspective or framework about [Topic]. Include:
   - Personal experience or case study: [Specific Example]
   - Data point or research: [Supporting Data]
   - Contrarian view or fresh angle: [Unique Take]

4. ACTIONABLE TAKEAWAY: Give 2-3 practical tips readers can implement:
   â€¢ Tip 1: [First Actionable Tip]
   â€¢ Tip 2: [Second Actionable Tip]
   â€¢ Tip 3: [Third Actionable Tip]

5. ENGAGEMENT: End with a question to encourage comments:
"What's your experience with [Topic]? Share in the comments ðŸ‘‡"

Hashtags: ##[Relevant Hashtag 1] ##[Relevant Hashtag 2] ##[Relevant Hashtag 3]

Tone: [Desired Tone - e.g., authoritative, conversational, inspiring]
Length: Keep under 1500 characters for optimal engagement

prompts.title: SEO-Optimized Blog Post Outline
prompts.description: Create a comprehensive blog post outline that ranks well in search engines
prompts.prompt:
Create a comprehensive blog post outline about [Topic] targeting [Target Audience].

SEO RESEARCH:
Primary keyword: [Primary Keyword]
Secondary keywords: [Secondary Keywords]
Search intent: [Search Intent]
Competitor analysis: [Competitor Insights]

BLOG POST OUTLINE:

1. COMPELLING TITLE (H1)
   - Include primary keyword naturally
   - Use numbers, questions, or emotional triggers
   - Keep under 60 characters
   - Options: [Title Options]

2. INTRODUCTION (150-200 words)
   - Hook with surprising statistic or relatable problem
   - State the main pain point [Pain Point]
   - Promise a solution/value proposition
   - Include primary keyword in first paragraph

3. MAIN CONTENT (3-5 sections)
   Section 1: [Section 1 Title]
   - Key points: [Section 1 Points]
   - Include secondary keyword: [Secondary Keyword 1]
   
   Section 2: [Section 2 Title]
   - Key points: [Section 2 Points]
   - Include secondary keyword: [Secondary Keyword 2]
   
   Section 3: [Section 3 Title]
   - Key points: [Section 3 Points]
   - Include secondary keyword: [Secondary Keyword 3]

4. PRACTICAL EXAMPLES
   - Case study: [Case Study Example]
   - Step-by-step process: [Process Example]
   - Real-world application: [Application Example]

5. CONCLUSION (100-150 words)
   - Summarize key takeaways
   - Reinforce main value proposition
   - Include call-to-action: [CTA]
   - End with question to encourage engagement

6. SEO ELEMENTS
   - Meta description: [Meta Description]
   - Featured image alt text: [Image Alt Text]
   - Internal linking opportunities: [Internal Links]
   - External authority links: [External Links]

Word count target: [Word Count]
Tone: [Content Tone]
Publishing date: [Publish Date]

prompts.title: Instagram Content Calendar
prompts.description: Plan a month's worth of engaging Instagram content for your brand
prompts.prompt:
Create a 30-day Instagram content calendar for [Brand Name] in the [Industry] industry.

BRAND GUIDELINES:

Visual style: [Visual Style]
Color palette: [Color Palette]
Target audience: [Target Audience Demographics]
Content pillars: [Content Pillars]

WEEKLY BREAKDOWN:

Week 1: [Week 1 Theme]
- Day 1: [Day 1 Content Type] - [Day 1 Description]
- Day 2: [Day 2 Content Type] - [Day 2 Description]
- Day 3: [Day 3 Content Type] - [Day 3 Description]
- Day 4: [Day 4 Content Type] - [Day 4 Description]
- Day 5: [Day 5 Content Type] - [Day 5 Description]
- Day 6: [Day 6 Content Type] - [Day 6 Description]
- Day 7: [Day 7 Content Type] - [Day 7 Description]

Week 2: [Week 2 Theme]
- Day 8-14: [Week 2 Content Plan]

Week 3: [Week 3 Theme]
- Day 15-21: [Week 3 Content Plan]

Week 4: [Week 4 Theme]
- Day 22-30: [Week 4 Content Plan]

CONTENT MIX STRATEGY:
- Educational posts: [Educational Content Ratio]%
- Entertainment posts: [Entertainment Content Ratio]%
- Promotional posts: [Promotional Content Ratio]%
- User-generated content: [UGC Content Ratio]%
- Behind-the-scenes: [BTS Content Ratio]%

ENGAGEMENT TACTICS:
- Hashtag strategy: [Hashtag Strategy]
- Story series: [Story Series Ideas]
- Interactive elements: [Interactive Elements]
- Collaboration opportunities: [Collaboration Ideas]

PERFORMANCE METRICS:

- Reach goal: [Reach Goal]
- Follower growth target: [Follower Growth Target]
- Website clicks target: [Website Clicks Target]

prompts.title: Financial Projection Model
prompts.description: Create comprehensive financial projections for business planning and investor presentations
prompts.prompt:
Create a comprehensive 3-year financial projection model for [Company Name].

BUSINESS OVERVIEW:
Company type: [Business Type]
Industry: [Industry]
Current revenue: [Current Annual Revenue]
Growth stage: [Growth Stage]

REVENUE PROJECTIONS:
Year 1:
- Q1: [Q1 Revenue] - Growth drivers: [Q1 Growth Drivers]
- Q2: [Q2 Revenue] - Growth drivers: [Q2 Growth Drivers]
- Q3: [Q3 Revenue] - Growth drivers: [Q3 Growth Drivers]
- Q4: [Q4 Revenue] - Growth drivers: [Q4 Growth Drivers]
Total Year 1: [Year 1 Total]

Year 2:
- Total revenue: [Year 2 Total] - Growth rate: [Year 2 Growth Rate]%
- Key assumptions: [Year 2 Assumptions]

Year 3:
- Total revenue: [Year 3 Total] - Growth rate: [Year 3 Growth Rate]%
- Key assumptions: [Year 3 Assumptions]

COST STRUCTURE:
- Fixed costs: [Fixed Costs Breakdown]
- Variable costs: [Variable Costs Breakdown]
- COGS: [COGS Breakdown]
- Operating expenses: [OpEx Breakdown]

KEY METRICS:
- Gross margin: [Gross Margin Target]%
- Net margin: [Net Margin Target]%
- Customer acquisition cost: [CAC Target]
- Customer lifetime value: [LTV Target]
- Break-even point: [Break-even Timeline]

SCENARIOS:
Best case: [Best Case Assumptions]
Base case: [Base Case Assumptions]
Worst case: [Worst Case Assumptions]

FUNDING REQUIREMENTS:
- Capital needed: [Funding Amount]
- Use of funds: [Use of Funds Breakdown]
- Runway: [Runway Period]
- Key milestones: [Funding Milestones]

prompts.title: Sales Page Copy Framework
prompts.description: Create persuasive sales page copy that converts visitors into customers
prompts.prompt:
Write high-converting sales page copy for [Product/Service Name].

PRODUCT DETAILS:
Product name: [Product/Service Name]
Main benefit: [Main Benefit]
Price point: [Price]
Target audience: [Target Customer]
Pain points solved: [Pain Points]
Unique selling proposition: [USP]

SALES PAGE STRUCTURE:

1. HERO SECTION
Headline: [Hero Headline]
Sub-headline: [Hero Sub-headline]
Call-to-action: [Primary CTA]
Social proof: [Hero Social Proof]

2. PROBLEM AGITATION
Current situation: [Problem Description]
Emotional impact: [Emotional Impact]
Failed solutions: [Failed Solutions]
Cost of inaction: [Cost of Inaction]

3. SOLUTION INTRODUCTION
Product reveal: [Solution Introduction]
How it works: [How It Works]
Key features: [Key Features]

4. SOCIAL PROOF SECTION
Testimonials: [Testimonials]
Case studies: [Case Studies]
Statistics: [Proof Statistics]
Media mentions: [Media Mentions]
Awards/recognition: [Awards]

5. OFFER DETAILS
What's included: [Package Contents]
Bonuses: [Bonus Items]
Guarantee: [Guarantee Details]
Scarcity element: [Scarcity Element]
Urgency driver: [Urgency Driver]

6. OBJECTION HANDLING
Price objection: [Price Objection Response]
Competitor comparison: [Competitor Comparison]
Risk reversal: [Risk Reversal]
Alternative options: [Alternative Options]

7. FINAL CTA SECTION
Urgency reminder: [Final Urgency]

Immediate action incentive: [Immediate Action Bonus]
Payment options: [Payment Options]

8. ADDITIONAL ELEMENTS
FAQ section: [FAQ Items]
About brand: [Brand Story]
Contact information: [Contact Details]
Privacy policy: [Privacy Assurance]

CONVERSION OPTIMIZATION:
- Page load speed target: [Load Speed Target]
- Mobile optimization: [Mobile Optimization]
- A/B test elements: [A/B Test Ideas]
- Analytics tracking: [Analytics Setup]

prompts.title: Twitter Thread Strategy
prompts.description: Create engaging Twitter threads that drive conversations and shares
prompts.prompt:
Create a compelling Twitter thread about [Topic] for [Your Brand/Handle].

THREAD OVERVIEW:
Main topic: [Topic]
Target audience: [Target Audience]
Thread length: [Number of Tweets]
Goal: [Primary Goal]
Call-to-action: [Thread CTA]

THREAD STRUCTURE:

Tweet 1 (Hook):
- Content: [Hook Tweet Content]
- Hashtags: [Hook Hashtags]
- Media: [Hook Media Type]
- Engagement tactic: [Hook Engagement]

Tweet 2 (Context):
- Content: [Context Tweet Content]
- Reply to Tweet 1: [Context Reply Strategy]
- Supporting point: [Context Supporting Point]
- Transition to next: [Context Transition]

Tweet 3 (Value):
- Content: [Value Tweet Content]
- Key insight: [Value Key Insight]
- Data/statistic: [Value Data Point]
- Visual element: [Value Visual]

Tweet 4 (Example):
- Content: [Example Tweet Content]
- Case study: [Example Case Study]
- Real-world application: [Example Application]
- Proof point: [Example Proof]

Tweet 5 (Action):
- Content: [Action Tweet Content]
- Step-by-step: [Action Steps]
- Resource link: [Action Resource]
- Tool recommendation: [Action Tool]

Tweet 6 (Engagement):
- Content: [Engagement Tweet Content]
- Question for audience: [Engagement Question]
- Poll option: [Engagement Poll]
- Tagging strategy: [Engagement Tags]

Tweet 7 (CTA):
- Content: [CTA Tweet Content]
- Link to resource: [CTA Link]
- Urgency element: [CTA Urgency]
- Final hashtag: [Final Hashtag]

ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY:
- Tweet timing: [Posting Schedule]
- Reply strategy: [Reply Plan]
- Community interaction: [Community Engagement]
- Influencer tagging: [Influencer Tags]

OPTIMIZATION ELEMENTS:
- A/B test hooks: [Hook A/B Tests]
- Visual consistency: [Visual Guidelines]
- Thread formatting: [Formatting Rules]
- Analytics tracking: [Analytics Setup]

FOLLOW-UP CONTENT:
- Thread summary: [Summary Content]
- Extended discussion: [Extended Content]
- Related threads: [Related Topics]
- Community highlights: [Community Highlights]
